keyMoments.title: Gancho's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Gancho, the king of the Tontatta Kingdom, emerges from Robin's clothes and greets Usopp and Robin, revealing his role as the leader of the dwarf tribe.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the leader of the Tontatta rebellion who will organize the forces against Doflamingo.

keyMoments.title: Reveals 900-Year History
keyMoments.description: Gancho reveals that the conflict between the Tontatta and Donquixote Family dates back 900 years to the Void Century when the original King Donquixote enslaved the dwarves.
keyMoments.significance: Connects the Dressrosa conflict to the Void Century and reveals the deep historical roots of the struggle.
keyMoments.quote: The history between the dwarves and the Donquixote Family started not ten years ago, but dates back even to 900 years ago.

relationships.description: Gancho is the king of the Tontatta Kingdom and works with Leo to organize the rebellion.

reveals.information: The Tontatta tribe's conflict with the Donquixote Family dates back 900 years to the Void Century
King of the Tontatta Kingdom, also called Tonta-Chief

keyMoments.title: Kabu's Devil Fruit Revealed
keyMoments.description: Kabu reveals his Mushi Mushi no Mi, Model: Kabutomushi by transforming into his hybrid rhinoceros beetle form to fly.
keyMoments.significance: First display of a dwarf with Devil Fruit powers, showing the Tontatta's combat capabilities.

abilities.description: Kabu can transform into a rhinoceros beetle or hybrid form, allowing him to fly and use his enhanced strength.

reveals.information: User of the Mushi Mushi no Mi, Model: Kabutomushi (Bug-Bug Fruit, Rhinoceros Beetle Model)
Yellow Kabu Squad Leader of the Tontatta Kingdom

keyMoments.title: Bian's Devil Fruit Revealed
keyMoments.description: Bian reveals her Mushi Mushi no Mi, Model: Suzumebachi, which allows her to transform into a hornet.
keyMoments.significance: Further demonstrates the Tontatta tribe's combat strength with multiple Devil Fruit users.

abilities.description: Bian can transform into a hornet or hybrid form, allowing her to fly and potentially use a stinger attack.

reveals.information: User of the Mushi Mushi no Mi, Model: Suzumebachi (Bug-Bug Fruit, Hornet Model)
Pink Bee Squad Leader of the Tontatta Kingdom

keyMoments.title: Recognized as Legendary Hero Usoland
keyMoments.description: The dwarves celebrate Usopp as the legendary hero 'Usoland,' placing complete faith in him to lead them to victory in rescuing their captured comrades.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Usopp's crucial role as the inspirational figure for the Tontatta rebellion, creating the burden of living up to their expectations.
keyMoments.quote: With the great Usoland by our side, we shall rescue our fellow dwarves!

relationships.description: Leo and the Tontatta dwarves view Usopp as their legendary hero Usoland and place complete faith in him.

evolutionMoments.description: The dwarves celebrate Usopp's arrival and rally around him as their prophesied hero.

reveals.information: Known as 'Usoland' to the Tontatta dwarves, who believe he is a legendary hero

keyMoments.title: Ato Ato no Mi Powers Fully Demonstrated
keyMoments.description: Giolla reveals she ate the Ato Ato no Mi and fully demonstrates her ability to transform objects and people into works of art, rendering Nami's weapons and Chopper's abilities useless.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the full extent of Giolla's Devil Fruit abilities and creates a major crisis on the Thousand Sunny.

abilities.description: Giolla can throw colored clouds to transform objects and people into abstract works of art, rendering them useless or dysfunctional.

reveals.information: User of the Ato Ato no Mi (Art-Art Fruit), making her an Art Human who can transform things into art
